questions.text: Which one of these foods is likely to contain the most bacteria?
What are communicable diseases? State any two examples.

Prakhar came back from school and ate the rice that was kept outside on the dining table. After few hours, he complained of diarrhoea and abdominal pain. His mother took him to the doctor who explained why this happened and asked them to preserve their food properly. 

(a) What must happened to Prakhar?

(b) Give the probable cause for his condition.

(c) Mention the values shown by the doctor.

Sachin opened two packets of milo drink. He left one in the refrigerator and another on the table. Three days later, he got a bad smell from the packet left on the table. The packet of milo drink in the refrigerator did not have a bad smell. Explain why:

  1. Milo kept in refrigerator did not smell bad?
  2. Milo kept in outside smelled bad?
Identify the given microorganism and select the incorrect statement regarding it.
mcOptions: It results in the spoilage of food materials.

It is an autotrophic fungus that causes
various diseases in plants, animals
and humans.
It is a saprophyte commonly called as black bread mould.

questions.text:
Following is the data of four species $\left(S_1-S_4\right)$ present (+) or absent (-) in five different habitats (P, Q, R, S and T).
Which species has the maximum diversity?

  P Q R S T
 $S_1$  - - - + +
 $S_2$  + ++
 + -
 $S_3$  - - - - +
 $S_4$  + - + - +
